MemoryDomain.description: The MemoryDomain schema describes a memory domain and its configuration.  Memory domains indicate to the client which memory, or DIMMs, can be grouped together in memory chunks to represent addressable memory.
MemoryDomain.longDescription: This Resource shall represent memory domains in a Redfish implementation.

^([a-zA-Z_][a-zA-Z0-9_]*)?@(odata|Redfis.description: This property shall specify a valid odata or Redfish property.

AllowsBlockProvisioning.description: An indication of whether this memory domain supports the provisioning of blocks of memory.
AllowsBlockProvisioning.longDescription: This property shall indicate whether this memory domain supports the creation of blocks of memory.

AllowsMemoryChunkCreation.description: An indication of whether this memory domain supports the creation of memory chunks.
AllowsMemoryChunkCreation.longDescription: This property shall indicate whether this memory domain supports the creation of memory chunks.

InterleavableMemorySets.description: The interleave sets for the memory chunk.
InterleavableMemorySets.longDescription: This property shall represent the interleave sets for the memory chunk.

MemoryChunks.description: The link to the collection of memory chunks associated with this memory domain.
MemoryChunks.longDescription: This property shall contain a link to a Resource Collection of type MemoryChunkCollection.

Oem.longDescription: This property shall contain the OEM extensions.  All values for properties that this object contains shall conform to the Redfish Specification-described requirements.

MemorySet.description: The interleave sets for a memory chunk.
MemorySet.longDescription: This type shall represent the interleave sets for a memory chunk.

^([a-zA-Z_][a-zA-Z0-9_]*)?@(odata|Redfis.description: This property shall specify a valid odata or Redfish property.

MemorySet.description: The set of memory for a particular interleave set.
MemorySet.longDescription: The values in this array shall be links to Resources of the Memory type.

title: #MemoryDomain.v1_0_5.MemoryDomain
